page.title: 01Introduction-Rugby(04480270)
page.content: This area is mainly of a rural nature,with a pocket of new housing estates to the north-west and the old, attractive village of{Dunchurch} (mentioned in the original Domesday book) in the west. Mixed farming is the predominant form of agriculture. The M45 motorway,which connects south Coventry to the M1 motorway, passes east to west through the center of the area. In the east of the block,a disused railway line,once part of the Great Central Railway between Nottingham and Marylebone Station,London,runs north to south. Onley Youth Custody Center, which houses approximately 400 young offenders,is another major feature of the area.
